title: Roxy Jacenko is hiring an intern for her Sweaty Betty PR office after poo jogger scandal went viral
text:
The publicity queen at the centre of Sydney's poo jogger saga is on the lookout for an intern.

Earlier this month, Roxy Jacenko shared footage of the female runner defecating outside her office in Watson Street, Sydney, in a bid to identify the culprit.

Now, Roxy is on a different kind of hunt as she looks to find a new employee for her Sweaty Betty PR business.

The company posted an advert on Instagram, announcing the intern position, which will start in November.

They wrote: 'In a first for our companies, @roxyjacenko is looking for an Intern to work alongside her to assist with the day to day happenings of the RJC Group of Companies.

'Are you keen to learn the inner workings of the multiple agencies by the side of the founder?

'Do you run not walk and pick up the empty box instead of walk around it?

'You need to be available on Fridays and one additional day per week for a 12 week period starting November 2019.'

Messy business! Roxy Jacenko managed to turn the poo jogger into a business opportunity with a sponsored advert to promote the well-known fibre supplement Metamucil

Opportunity knocks: The company posted an advert on Instagram, announcing the intern position which will start in November

Roxy's office in the wealthy suburb of Paddington was the scene of the now infamous poo jogger saga.

It began when Roxy uploaded videos of the woman running behind a car, pulling down her pants and relieving herself on two occasions.

Furious with the young woman's behaviour, Roxy told Daily Mail Australia she had found faeces on the street for three weeks.

Who is it? Roxy told Daily Mail Australia she had found faeces on the street outside her office for three weeks

The footage has since been deleted from Roxy's Instagram account after her followers began pointing the finger at different people.

Last week, it was reported that Roxy had tracked down the culprit who is said to have deleted her social media presence in a bid to stay hidden.

The saga was featured on A Current Affair last week and concluded with host Tracy Grimshaw telling viewers the mystery blonde has been identified - but her name has yet to be made public.

description: The publicity queen at the centre of Sydney's poo jogger saga is on the lookout for an intern.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
